content.question: The function f is continuous for all real numbers, and the average rate of change of f on the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>6</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>9</mn> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C04@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mn>3</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38C8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>6</mn><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B17@</annotation> </semantics> </math> there is no value of c such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>c</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mn>3</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D55@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Of the following, which must be true?

choices.label: <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B6E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all x in the open interval (6,9).
f is not differentiable on the open interval (6,9).

content.answer: f is not differentiable on the open interval (6,9).

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
